abstract: Video footage showing Tulsa, Okla, police officers waiting for emergency medical team to assist gunshot victim Terence Crutcher raises debate on whether police should aid victims of line-of-duty shootings; Police Executive Research Forum recommends officers render first aid when they can, but some criminal justice experts argue it adds another responsibility to overburdened police.

headline.print_headline: Why First Aid Is Often Lacking in Critical Moments After a Police Shooting
headline.main: Why First Aid Is Often Lacking in the Moments After a Police Shooting

keywords.value: John Jay College of Criminal Justice
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: A police research group suggests that departments install requirements for officers to render first aid, even to people they may have just shot....
